revised_title: Peter Frederick Baker: A Pioneering Biologist and Neuroscientist
tldr: Peter Frederick Baker was a renowned biologist and neuroscientist who made significant contributions to the understanding of nerve conduction, sodium pump mechanisms, and fertilization. His work on internal perfusion of nerve fibers and phosphorus metabolism helped advance the field of neurobiology. Baker's research on fertilization in sea urchin eggs provided insights into the mechanisms of polyspermy and the role of calcium in the process.
